trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to a Windows Phone Silverlight app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to a Windows Phone Silverlight app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs to the quickstart project.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs to the quickstart project.

trans-unit.source: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification using Notification Hubs each time a record is inserted.
trans-unit.target: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification using Notification Hubs each time a record is inserted.

trans-unit.source: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.
trans-unit.target: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the TodoList sample app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the TodoList sample app.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the topic [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] to connect your project to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the topic [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] to connect your project to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: When a mobile service has not been connected, the Add Push Notification wizard can create this connection for you.
trans-unit.target: When a mobile service has not been connected, the Add Push Notification wizard can create this connection for you.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]To send push notifications to a Windows Phone 8.1 Store app, follow the [Windows Store app](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-push.md) version of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]To send push notifications to a Windows Phone 8.1 Store app, follow the [Windows Store app](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-push.md) version of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Update the app to register for notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the app to register for notifications

trans-unit.source: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.
trans-unit.target: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: Add the following to App.xaml.cs:
trans-unit.target: Add the following to App.xaml.cs:

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS) used by Windows Phone 8.x "Silverlight", and then registers that ChannelURI for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS) used by Windows Phone 8.x "Silverlight", and then registers that ChannelURI for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]In this this tutorial, the mobile service sends a toast notification to the device.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]In this this tutorial, the mobile service sends a toast notification to the device.

trans-unit.source: When you send a tile notification, you must instead call the **BindToShellTile** method on the channel.
trans-unit.target: When you send a tile notification, you must instead call the **BindToShellTile** method on the channel.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the **Application_Launching** event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new **AcquirePushChannel** method:
trans-unit.target: At the top of the **Application_Launching** event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new **AcquirePushChannel** method:

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that registration is requested every time that the page is loaded.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that registration is requested every time that the page is loaded.

trans-unit.source: In your app, you may only want to make this registration periodically to ensure that the registration is current.
trans-unit.target: In your app, you may only want to make this registration periodically to ensure that the registration is current.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer, expand **Properties**, open the WMAppManifest.xml file, click the **Capabilities** tab and make sure that the **ID___CAP___PUSH_NOTIFICATION** capability is checked.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer, expand **Properties**, open the WMAppManifest.xml file, click the **Capabilities** tab and make sure that the **ID___CAP___PUSH_NOTIFICATION** capability is checked.

trans-unit.source: Enable notifications in VS
trans-unit.target: Enable notifications in VS

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: Update server scripts to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update server scripts to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Finally, you must update the script registered to the insert operation on the TodoItem table to send notifications.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you must update the script registered to the insert operation on the TodoItem table to send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Click **TodoItem**, click **Script** and select **Insert**.
trans-unit.target: Click **TodoItem**, click **Script** and select **Insert**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click **Save**:
trans-unit.target: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click **Save**:

trans-unit.source: This insert script sends a push notification (with the text of the inserted item) to all Windows Phone app registrations after the insert succeeds.
trans-unit.target: This insert script sends a push notification (with the text of the inserted item) to all Windows Phone app registrations after the insert succeeds.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Push** tab, check **Enable unauthenticated push notifications**, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Push** tab, check **Enable unauthenticated push notifications**, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: This enables the mobile service to connect to MPNS in unauthenticated mode to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This enables the mobile service to connect to MPNS in unauthenticated mode to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.

trans-unit.source: In this mode, MPNS limits the number of notifications that can be sent to a device channel.
trans-unit.target: In this mode, MPNS limits the number of notifications that can be sent to a device channel.

trans-unit.source: To remove this restriction, you must generate and upload a certificate by clicking **Upload** and selecting the certificate.
trans-unit.target: To remove this restriction, you must generate and upload a certificate by clicking **Upload** and selecting the certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more information on generating the certificate, see [Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone].
trans-unit.target: For more information on generating the certificate, see [Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone].

trans-unit.source: Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: Test push notifications in your app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You may encounter a 401 Unauthorized RegistrationAuthorizationException when testing on the Windows Phone emulator.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You may encounter a 401 Unauthorized RegistrationAuthorizationException when testing on the Windows Phone emulator.

trans-unit.source: This can occur during the `RegisterNativeAsync()` call because of the way the Windows Phone emulator syncs it's clock with the host PC.
trans-unit.target: This can occur during the `RegisterNativeAsync()` call because of the way the Windows Phone emulator syncs it's clock with the host PC.

trans-unit.source: It can result in a security token that will be rejected.
trans-unit.target: It can result in a security token that will be rejected.

trans-unit.source: To resolve this simply manually set the clock in the emulator before testing.
trans-unit.target: To resolve this simply manually set the clock in the emulator before testing.

trans-unit.source: In the app, enter the text "hello push" in the textbox, click **Save**, then immediately click the start button or back button to leave the app.
trans-unit.target: In the app, enter the text "hello push" in the textbox, click **Save**, then immediately click the start button or back button to leave the app.

trans-unit.source: Enter text into the app
trans-unit.target: Enter text into the app

trans-unit.source: This sends an insert request to the mobile service to store the added item.
trans-unit.target: This sends an insert request to the mobile service to store the added item.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the device receives a toast notification that says **hello push**.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the device receives a toast notification that says **hello push**.

trans-unit.source: Toast notification received
trans-unit.target: Toast notification received

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You will not receive the notification when you are still in the app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You will not receive the notification when you are still in the app.

trans-unit.source: To receive a toast notification while the app is active, you must handle the [ShellToastNotificationReceived](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsphone/develop/microsoft.phone.notification.httpnotificationchannel.shelltoastnotificationreceived.aspx) event.
trans-unit.target: To receive a toast notification while the app is active, you must handle the [ShellToastNotificationReceived](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsphone/develop/microsoft.phone.notification.httpnotificationchannel.shelltoastnotificationreceived.aspx) event.
